column4: hi i want change this crap windows to ubuntu but all my data music i have ti on two hard drives in NTFS how i can do without loss all
just do not format those drives (whatever you do) .. find space elsewhere to install ubuntu on .. or use a partition manager to make space accordingly
linux does not install on ntfs volume (well, atleast ubuntu does not) and requires atleast 2 free partitions on one harddrive
if i understand you correctly, yes, install ubuntu on one harddrive (with 2 free partitions on it) .. and yes you can write to NTFS drives using ubuntu
